newsitem.title: USA: Comprehensive Care unit wins contract.
newsitem.headline: Comprehensive Care unit wins contract.

text.p: Comprehensive Care Corp on Monday said its unit, Comprehensive Behavioral Care, has agreed to provide mental health and substance abuse care to HIP of New Jersey's 170,000 members.
In addition, the unit will provide management for the behavioral health staff at HIP, a managed health care service provider. Financial terms of the deal were undisclosed.

"This contract is one of our largest to date, adding significantly to our strong base of managed care contracts and covered lives," said Stuart Ghertner, interim president of Comprehensive Behavioral Care.
